Hi!


Is there any way that you can get JUnit not to start its own 
classloader? I have an (signed) applet, that will download some jar 
files over the net and store them on disk. The applet will also 
create its  own classloader, which will be associated with the 
directory where the jar files (including the file containing the test 
case) are stored. The last thing the applet will do, is to call a 
method in some predefined class. It is in this class that I am trying 
to start JUnit, with a call to TestRunner. The problem is that if 
JUnit starts its own CL - which, if I understand correctly, is a CL 
directly under the System CL - there is no way that JUnit CL will 
find the test case class. Is there any way around this?

Cheers, Jonas
